channel.title: ECP5 on James Horton
channel.description: Recent content in ECP5 on James Horton

item.title: Opensource FPGA tools for ECP5 Evaluation Board
item.description: In this post I am recording how I got my first design onto the ECP5 Development board that I recently purchased. This devboard makes use of the LFE5UM5G FPGA, on a pcb, with lots of IO broken out including the SERDES Pins. For this example, I am using the on-board 8 LED’s, and an example that I originally used with my icebreaker board and an LED PMod. Getting the ECP5 Devboard setup As a Macbook Air user, with its M1 processor, sometimes means getting the right tools can be a challenge.
